It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with conservation concerns.
